column4: I've downloaded ubuntu  and installed it on to a windows partition. After i installed it, i notice that when i try to ssh to a server on the network i get this error: debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP
Read from socket failed: Connection reset by peer
for some reason im not able to log in to a box onto a network although i can ping it.
When you ping it are you pinging it on the port you are trying to connect on?
yes i can run a telnet to it. so i know it's open
My guess would be authentication problem then, have you checked the error logs?
no i dont even get a password prompt. there is no issue with authentication.
and actually in my error message this is what i see: debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP
i did this with ssh -vvv ... i only get this with ubuntu
Are you connecting with SSH2 or SSH?
i can connect with redhat and windows to these servers - as they are also installed on this same laptop
OpenSSH_5.8p1 Debian-1ubuntu3, OpenSSL 0.9.8o 01 Jun 2010
why only on ubuntu i cant connect via ssh?
I think you need to try with SSH2 instead of SSH
umm i am using the ssh that comes with the install
but the error message said it was expecting SSH2 no?
how would i use ssh2 instead then?
i am doing: ssh [username]@[server]
and why doesnt ubuntu come default with ssh2 instead of ssh?
I don't know. But I am sure you can get it from the repository
hey i changed my client config to use Protocol 2 and it still does the same thing
Same error?
yes
